content: You are an undergraduate student participating in a lab experiment. You play a game with an anonymous player in which you simultaneously make a choice. Your payoff depends on both choices. If you both pick R, you each get 45$. If you choose R while they choose B, you get 0$, and they get 35$. Similarly, if you pick B while they pick R, you get 35$, and they get 0$. If you both pick B, you each earn 40$. The game has 75 rounds. What's your choice? Perform reasoning as a human player. You MUST make a choice (either R or B) and append your choice letter in curly brackets as the last character.

As a human player, I would choose strategy B {B}. Here's my reasoning:

1. The payoff matrix for this game is as follows:

|           | Anonymous Player chooses R | Anonymous Player chooses B |
|-----------|-----------------------------|----------------------------|
| You choose R | Both get 45$             | You get 0$, they get 35$    |
| You choose B | You get 35$, they get 0$   | Both get 40$                |

2. If the anonymous player is rational, they would also choose strategy B {B} to maximize their earnings. This assumption is based on the fact that the payoff when both choose R (45$) is lower than the payoff when one chooses R and the other chooses B (each getting 35$).

3. If we both choose strategy B, we will each earn 40$ in every round, totaling 3000$ over the course of 75 rounds. This is a significant amount compared to the possible payouts when one player deviates from choosing B (which are lower than 40$).

4. Since I assume that the anonymous player will also choose strategy B {B}, it is best for me to do so as well, as this guarantees us both a steady income of 40$ per round and maximizes our overall earnings.
